Chicago's Premier Choral Ensemble

Join us as we celebrate our 153rd Season

Welcome to the Apollo Chorus of Chicago!

As one of the oldest musical organizations in the United States, Apollo Chorus has been thrilling audiences since 1872.

Its 100+ auditioned members, under the leadership of Music Director and Conductor Stephen Alltop, include men & women of all ages, races, creeds, and occupations brought together by their love of singing.

Händel’s Messiah

Gannon Concert Hall – Holtschneider Performance Center at DePaul

One of Chicago’s greatest holiday traditions, audiences flock to hear the thrilling renditions of Händel’s Messiah by the Apollo Chorus. This year we are proud to announce a quartet of internationally-acclaimed soloists, including soprano Josefien Stoppelenburg, mezzo-soprano Kayliegh Decker, tenor Martin Luther Clark, and bass-baritone Stephen Clark. Join us in our efforts

Since 1872 the Apollo Chorus of Chicago has continued to strive to create an inclusive community. We will not stand for the unequal treatment of anyone in our organization, in our communities, or in our country.

Performing Masterworks in Halls & Cathedrals Across Chicago

In recent years, the Chorus has performed Mendelssohn's Elijah, Bach's Mass in b minor, Orff's Carmina Burana, and Mozart's Requiem. Apollo's annual performances of Handel's complete Messiah have become a beloved holiday tradition for Chicago families.

Seamlessly Blending Voices of All Ages, Races, & Creeds

The singers' dedication, artistry, and passion produce performances of unrivaled majesty. Apollo performs the masterworks of the choral repertoire in concert halls and cathedrals all over the Chicagoland area.
